greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle: T(n,k) = number of compositions (ordered partitions) of n such that some part is repeated consecutively k times and no part is repeated consecutively more than k times.
comment: Cf. A232294 - A128695 = column 3. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 24 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..100, flattened
example: In the partition 3+3+2+2+2+1+3+3+1, 2 is repeated consecutively 3 times, no part is repeated consecutively more than 3 times. (3 appears 4 times nonconsecutively.)
maple: b:= proc(n, l, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(`if`(
i=l, 0, add(b(n-i*j, i, k), j=1..min(k, n/i))), i=1..n))
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..14);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 08 2017
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 23 2004
